page.title: 01Farmland South of Adderley
page.content: This is an unspectacular area of North Shropshire ranging between 203 & 340ft above sea level, pock marked with small ponds and with the river Duckow meandering thro' its western part. There are about a dozen small farms, mostly engaged in mixed farming and employing much of the sparse population. A main road, the A529, crosses the block almost north to south and along this, on Wednesdays only, run two bus routes. In addition to this road less than 14 ft wide neither level nor straight, and two public footpaths. The Shropshire Union Canal runs north south through the three eastern squares of the block with no public bridges crossing it. The canal is used exclusively and fairly heavily for leisure activities. This is manages by Inland waterways.
